entry.title: Week 43, 2025: Package directory isolation and Dune 3.21.0 prep, opam cmdliner vendoring, LSP code lens config, js_of_ocaml OCaml 5.4 support
entry.content:
New Features

  • Dune: Package directory isolation via (dir ..) field enables automatic filtering with --only-packages (ocaml/dune#12614), automatic Dune self-pinning prevents package incompatibilities (ocaml/dune#12583), conflict marker detection for Git/diff3/Jujutsu in cram tests (ocaml/dune#12617, ocaml/dune#12616), parallelized Melange cmj/cmi rule creation (ocaml/dune#12626), and OxCaml development environment with Nix devShells (ocaml/dune#12582)
  • opam: Installation script support for 2.5.0~alpha1 with platform binaries and checksums (ocaml/opam#6748), OpenBSD static linking support (ocaml/opam#6705), and opam repo show command for repository information (ocaml/opam#6720)
  • ocaml-lsp: Configurable code lenses for nested bindings via for_nested_bindings option (ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1567) and metrics timestamp precision improved to sub-second measurement (ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1565)
  • jsofocaml: Fixed Wasm runtime caml_floatarray_concat type checking bug preventing crashes (1621a19)

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • cmdliner 2.0 migration coordinated across ocaml/opam (ocaml/opam#6755, ocaml/opam#6756, ocaml/opam#6757) and ocsigen/jsofocaml (ocsigen/jsofocaml#2118), with Daniel Bünzli providing architectural guidance to both projects about exit code propagation and API compatibility
  • OCaml 5.4 compatibility tracked across ocaml/ocaml-lsp with CI fixes merged and ocsigen/jsofocaml with expanded test coverage (ocsigen/jsofocaml#2103, ocsigen/jsofocaml#2115)
  • OxCaml experimental support advancing in parallel across ocaml/dune with parameterized libraries (ocaml/dune#12561) and Nix devShells (ocaml/dune#12582), and ocsigen/jsofocaml with draft implementation (ocsigen/jsofocaml#2105)
  • Windows platform fixes coordinated between ocaml/ocamlfind (ocaml/ocamlfind#112) addressing issues reported in ocaml/opam#6732 and ocaml/opam-repository#28636
  • Merlin integration work continues in ocaml/dune with file loading fixes for multiple executables (ocaml/dune#12621) corresponding to bugs reported in ocaml/merlin (ocaml/merlin#1980, ocaml/merlin#1977)

    • Notable Discussions

  • dune-project formatting improvements proposed by Tom Ekander to group related fields and reduce excessive spacing for better readability (ocaml/dune#12629)
  • cmdliner 2.0 adoption strategies debated between Kate and Daniel Bünzli on ocaml/opam#6755, with Daniel Bünzli suggesting simpler workarounds using CMDLINER_LEGACY_PREFIXES and custom Arg.enum, while Brian Ward noted cross-compilation impacts preventing simultaneous native and Windows builds (ocaml/opam#6425)
  • OCAMLPATH priority ordering debated between Kate and David Allsopp regarding whether opam site-lib should override compiler META files (ocaml/ocamlfind#106)
  • Recursive module shape resolution analyzed by Thomas Refis revealing Merlin shape system limitations where UIDs fail to resolve despite appearing correct (ocaml/merlin#1980)
  • Code lens configuration design discussed between Ulysse and Tim ats about option naming evolution from only_toplevel to for_nested_bindings for future extensibility (ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1567)

    • Emerging Trends

  • Package management maturation across the toolchain with Dune adding self-pinning (ocaml/dune#12583), portable lockdir platform grouping (ocaml/dune#12620), and ocamlformat version tracking (ocaml/dune#12605), while opam prepares 2.5.0~alpha1 release (ocaml/opam#6748)
  • Cross-platform support improvements with Windows fixes in ocamlfind (ocaml/ocamlfind#112), OpenBSD static linking in opam (ocaml/opam#6705), and platform-specific binary distribution
  • Editor experience refinement through LSP code lens configuration (ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1567), metrics improvements (ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1565), and investigation of Merlin shape system bugs (ocaml/merlin#1980)
  • OCaml 5.4 adoption progressing with test infrastructure updates in jsofocaml (ocsigen/jsofocaml#2103, ocsigen/jsofocaml#2115) and CI fixes in ocaml-lsp
  • OxCaml experimental features advancing with parameterized library support in Dune (ocaml/dune#12561), development environments (ocaml/dune#12582), and jsofocaml implementation (ocsigen/jsofocaml#2105)
  • Dependency vendoring strategy emerging as preferred approach for handling breaking changes, seen in opam cmdliner vendoring (ocaml/opam#6755, ocaml/opam#6756, ocaml/opam#6757) to balance compatibility with modern library versions
entry.summary: Package directory isolation and Dune 3.21.0 prep, opam cmdliner vendoring, LSP code lens config, js_of_ocaml OCaml 5.4 support

  • WebAssembly eval function behavior discussion in ocsigen/jsofocaml between @hhugo and Jérôme Vouillon about ensuring runtime consistency between Wasm and JS backends (ocsigen/jsofocaml#2108)

entry.title: Week 41, 2025: Active week with OxCaml parameterized library support, Dune package management improvements, and opam workflow enhancements
entry.content:

entry.title: Week 40, 2025: OCaml 5.4 support across toolchain, performance improvements in dune/opam, multiple releases shipped
entry.content:
New Features

  • Dune promoted files now read-only to prevent accidental edits to generated files (ocaml/dune#12519 by Antonin Décimo)
  • Dune package management performance improvements for null builds, reducing build times from 8s to 1s through optimized lockdir parsing and hash computation (ocaml/dune#12248 via ocaml/dune#12487, ocaml/dune#12517, ocaml/dune#12518 by @v-gb, Stephen Sherratt)
  • Dune package release dev tools dune-release and opam-publish enrolled as installable dev tools (ocaml/dune#12522 by Sudha Parimala)
  • Merlin locate-types command enables navigation to all type identifiers within complex types like a -> (b * c), returning a tree structure with locations for each type component (ocaml/merlin#1951 by Liam Stevenson)
  • Merlin OCaml 5.4 support through vendored typer upgrade (ocaml/merlin#1971, ocaml/merlin#1974 by Xavier Van de Woestyne)
  • Merlin typer cache control via -use-typer-cache flag for debugging and testing (ocaml/merlin#1972 by Tim ats)
  • Merlin Vim plugin crash fix when :MerlinOccurrencesProjectWide encounters inaccurate text preview (ocaml/merlin#1970 by Jules Aguillon)
  • Opam incremental file loading reduces opam update time from ~10s to ~0.01s on Windows and ~3.5s to ~1ms on Unix by processing only changed files (ocaml/opam#6614 by @arozovyk, closes ocaml/opam#5824)
  • Opam Windows extra-files fix for false-positive mismatch warnings during opam update when processing nested extra-files (ocaml/opam#6715 by Kate)
  • Opam reftest engine improvements including new unset builtin (ocaml/opam#6708) and hardened regexp for variable checksum substitution (ocaml/opam#6710 by Kate)
  • OCaml-LSP OCaml 5.4 support enabling compilation with latest compiler version (ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1559 by Ulysse)
  • OCaml-LSP .mll file support fixed error when opening ocamllex files (ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1557 by Török Edwin)
  • OCaml-LSP method call hover fix now displays type information correctly (ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1553 by Ulysse, resolves ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1552)

    • Group Overview

  • OCaml 5.4 migration coordinated across toolchain with ocaml/merlin shipping two releases (5.6-503 and 5.6-504) and ocaml/ocaml-lsp shipping releases 1.23.1 and 1.24.0 (ocaml/merlin#1973, ocaml/merlin#1974, ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1558, ocaml/ocaml-lsp#1559)
  • Performance optimization focus with ocaml/dune achieving 8x build time reduction for null builds (ocaml/dune#12248) and ocaml/opam delivering 100-1000x faster opam update operations (ocaml/opam#6614)
  • Developer tooling improvements across ocaml/dune with release tools enrollment (ocaml/dune#12522), dev tools environment access (ocaml/dune#12521), and ocaml/merlin with enhanced navigation via locate-types command (ocaml/merlin#1951)
  • Windows platform compatibility addressed in ocaml/opam with extra-files fix (ocaml/opam#6715), reftest engine fixes (ocaml/opam#6716, ocaml/opam#6714), and macOS GHA compatibility work (ocaml/opam#6719)
  • Active repositories this week: ocaml/dune (20+ PRs), ocaml/merlin (8 PRs, 2 releases), ocaml/opam (15+ PRs), ocaml/ocaml-lsp (2 releases), ocsigen/jsofocaml (Oxcaml support PR opened)
  • Quiet repositories with no activity: ocaml/ocamlfind, ocaml/odoc, ocaml/opam-file-format, ocaml-dune/spawn

    • Cross-Repository Work

  • OCaml 5.4 compiler support coordinated across ocaml/merlin (#1971, #1974) and ocaml/ocaml-lsp (#1559), with both projects shipping releases to support the new compiler version
  • Package management ecosystem improvements spanning ocaml/dune with release tools enrollment (#12522) and ocaml/opam with incremental loading (#6614) and reproducible releases work (#6706)
  • Developer tooling enhancements across ocaml/dune with dev tools environment access (#12521) and ocaml/merlin with refactoring commands (#1948, #1894)
  • Performance optimization theme evident in ocaml/dune package management null build improvements (#12487, #12517, #12518) and ocaml/opam incremental loading (#6614) and depexts caching (#6489)
  • Cmdliner 2.0.0 compatibility addressed in both ocaml/opam (#6707) and ocsigen/jsofocaml (#2104) via opam-repository fix
  • Windows platform improvements coordinated in ocaml/opam with extra-files handling (#6715), reftest engine fixes (#6716, #6714), and MSys2 symlink investigation (#6712)

    • Notable Discussions

  • Opam repository redirect handling investigation into why repositories containing redirects are marked as changed (ocaml/opam#6717 by R. Boujbel, tracing back to ocaml/opam#5146)
  • Opam pin workflow regression where opam pin remove no longer upgrades to latest version after unpinning, causing switch recompilation with old version (ocaml/opam#6622 by Daniel Bünzli)
  • Opam OPAMFETCH tokenization issue where quoted arguments in environment variable are split by whitespace, breaking authorization headers for private GitHub repositories (ocaml/opam#5490 by SeungCheol Jung, PR ocaml/opam#5492)
  • Opam build-env field behavior discussion clarifying interaction between setenv and build-env, with agreement that build-env should apply after setenv (ocaml/opam#6574 by Daniel Bünzli and Kate, fix in ocaml/opam#6713)
  • Opam MSys2 symlink behavior under MinGW with Cygwin-incompatible default winsymlinks:deepcopy mode, potential for opam to control via MSYS=winsymlinks:native (ocaml/opam#6712 by Jan Midtgaard)
  • Jsofocaml performance costs of const/let bindings due to TDZ checks, referencing TypeScript, esbuild, and Scala.js decisions to continue using var (ocsigen/jsofocaml#1570 by Henry Till)

    • Emerging Trends

  • Compiler version support prioritized across toolchain with coordinated OCaml 5.4 adoption in ocaml/merlin (#1971, #1974) and ocaml/ocaml-lsp (#1559), ensuring rapid adoption of new compiler features
  • Build and update performance optimization emerged as cross-repository priority with ocaml/dune achieving 8x null build speedup (#12248 via #12487, #12517, #12518) and ocaml/opam delivering 100-1000x faster updates (#6614)
  • Developer experience improvements focusing on IDE integration with ocaml/dune dev tools environment access (#12521), ocaml/merlin enhanced navigation (#1951) and refactoring commands (#1948)
  • Windows and cross-platform compatibility receiving attention in ocaml/opam with multiple fixes (#6715, #6716, #6714, #6719) and platform-specific behavior investigation (#6712)
  • Test infrastructure hardening in ocaml/opam with reftest engine improvements (#6708, #6710) and macOS GHA compatibility work (#6719)
  • File format and dialect support expansion with ocaml/ocaml-lsp adding .mll support (#1557) and .mlx formatting work (#1528)
  • Package management ecosystem maturation with ocaml/dune release tools enrollment (#12522) and ongoing work on lock directories as targets (#11775)
entry.summary: OCaml 5.4 support across toolchain, performance improvements in dune/opam, multiple releases shipped
